channel.title: Bill Mainland Nelson
channel.description: Recent content on Bill Mainland Nelson

item.title: Reviews
item.description: Memorandum of Understanding ¶ “I love the dead-pan maleness of the poem ‘Charlie’s shed’, especially with its wonderfully contrived final lines, speaking eloquently of what endures and what is ephemeral” Nicholas Reid, Reid’s Reader

item.title: Writing
item.description: Memorandum of Understanding ¶ “No, seriously, it’s fucking great writing.” Simon Sweetman, goodreads.com A Game of Two Halves ¶ The best of the Sport 2005-2019 Across the Pass ¶ A collection of tramping writing Up Country ¶ A Journal for the New Zealand Outdoors Best New Zealand Poems ¶ Giant Steps (2010) | Memorandum of Understanding (2017) Against the Prevailing Winds - Courtenay Place Lightboxes ¶

item.title: Bill Mainland Nelson
item.description: Bill Nelson is a poet from Auckland, New Zealand. His book, ‘Memorandum of Understanding’ was published in 2016 by Victoria University Press. His poems have appeared in journals, dance performances, art galleries and on billstickers. Find him on email, twitter, instagram or github.
